item.title: So will der Bundesrat die UBS zähmen
item.author: Basler Zeitung
item.description: Die «Too big to fail»-Regeln (kurz TBTF) des Bundesrats sollen dafür sorgen, dass eine systemrelevante Grossbank in Schieflage geraten kann, ohne die Schweizer Wirtschaft in Mitleidenschaft zu ziehen oder Verwerfungen auf den Finanzmärkten auszulösen. Seit 2012 sind diese im Bankengesetz verankert, ...

item.title: BlackRock Gets Glimmer of Hope It Could Escape Texas Blacklist
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Texas Lieutenant Governor Dan Patrick offered a sliver of hope to BlackRock Inc. that it may be eventually removed from the state’s list of oil boycotters. The move came Thursday when Patrick laid out his wish-list for the state’s senate to study ahead of the 2025 legislative session...

item.title: Handful of ECB Officials Needed Extra Convincing to Back Hold
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- As many as five European Central Bank Governing Council members appeared to take longer than some of their peers to be convinced of keeping interest rates steady at Thursday’s policy meeting, people familiar with the matter said. A larger group initially favored cutting borrowing cos...

item.title: Lagarde Feels Pull of Fed’s Tractor Beam as ECB Plans Rate Cut
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- European Central Bank chief Christine Lagarde is striking a less defiant tone on the influence of Federal Reserve policy even as she firms up plans to go it alone with an interest-rate cut. Despite weeks of debate by colleagues on a path of future easing, the euro-zone monetary presi...

item.title: ECB Holds Interest Rates and Points to First Cut in June
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank held interest rates steady for a fifth meeting, while sending its clearest signal yet that cooling inflation will soon allow it to commence cuts. The deposit rate was left at a record-high 4%, as overwhelmingly predicted by a Bloomberg poll. But the Governing...

item.title: Global Rates Repricing Puts ECB on Track to Cut Rates Before Fed
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- In a week when traders bet on fewer and slower interest-rate cuts globally, the European Central Bank looks set to buck the trend. Money markets are sticking to wagers that the ECB will deliver a quarter-point cut in June. Meanwhile, they pushed back the expected start date for the Fe...

item.title: Too Many ECB Cuts Risk Spooking Markets, Allianz Chief Economist Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank risks a backlash from investors if its interest-rate policy strays too far from that of its US counterpart, according to Allianz Chief Economist Ludovic Subran. Speaking Thursday on Bloomberg Television, he told Dani Burger and Manus Cranny that Frankfurt-bas...

item.title: Bond Traders Are Preparing for a 5% Yield, No Rate Cut World
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Bond traders are readying for 10-year US Treasury yields surpassing 5% as the scenario of no rate cuts by the Federal Reserve this year looks increasingly possible. Schroders Plc is shorting US bonds across some tenors as sticky inflation raises the risk of higher-for-longer rates. Pa...

item.title: ECB to Hold With First Cut Locked In for June
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank is set to keep borrowing costs on hold for a fifth meeting while further readying the ground for cuts to begin in June. The deposit rate will be kept at a record-high 4% on Thursday, according to an almost unanimous poll of economists by Bloomberg. Just one o...

item.description: Die internationalen Börsenindizes liefen im März zunächst noch seitwärts, bis zur Monatsmitte eine Aufwärtsbewegung einsetzte. Doch einschneidende Eingriffe bleiben der UBS wohl erspart. Entsprechend sehen Anal...

item.author: cash.ch

Hier machten sich die Leitzinserhöhungen der Schweizerischen Nationalbank (SNB) bemerkbar. Damit hat si...

item.title: Erneuerbare Energien: Welche Risiken gehen Sie ein?
item.author: Cash.Online
item.description: Während erneuerbare Energien als Anlageklassen weiter ausreifen, haben sich Anlagestrategien in zwei unterschiedliche Kategorien abgetrennt. Der CEO Philipp Rickenbacher musste zurücktreten und wurde übergangsweise durch den Chief Operating ...

item.description: Auf den ersten Blick sieht es so aus, als hätte Sergio Ermotti ganze Arbeit geleistet. item.description:
Après
la débâcle de Credit Suisse, le gouvernement helvète veut revoir les règles pour les banques de taille systémique comme UBS, qui pèse maintenant deux fois l'économie du pays.
C'est une nouvelle qui n'a pas plu aux actionnaires d'UBS. Le gouvernement suisse veut renforcer les exigences en cap...
